TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract PivotTable

Docs.summary: Represents a PivotTable report on a worksheet. The PivotTable object is a member of the collection. The PivotTables collection contains all the PivotTable objects on a single worksheet.

remarks.para: Use PivotTables(), where is the PivotTable index number or name, to return a single PivotTable object.

Because PivotTable report programming can be complex, it’s generally easiest to record PivotTable report actions and then revise the recorded code. To record a macro, point to Macro on the Tools menu and then click Record New Macro.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ default { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void _PivotSelect([in]string Name, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlPTSelectionMode Mode) runtime managed
Public Sub _PivotSelect (Name As String, Optional Mode As XlPTSelectionMode = Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlPTSelectionMode.xlDataAndLabel)

Docs.param: To be added.
To be added.
Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ActiveFilters As PivotFilters

Docs.summary: Indicates the currently active filter in the specified . Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.PivotField AddDataField (object Field, object Caption, object Function);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.PivotField AddDataField([in]object Field, [in]object Caption, [in]object Function) runtime managed
Public Function AddDataField (Field As Object, Optional Caption As Object, Optional Function As Object) As PivotField

Docs.param: Required Object. The unique field on the server. If the source data is Online Analytical Processing (OLAP), the unique field is a cube field. If the source data is non-OLAP (non-OLAP source data), the unique field is a PivotTable field.
Optional Object. The label used in the PivotTable report to identify this data field.
Optional Object. The function performed in the added data field.
Docs.summary: Adds a data field to a PivotTable report. Returns a object that represents the new data field.

MemberSignature.Value: public object AddFields (object RowFields, object ColumnFields, object PageFields, object AddToTable);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object AddFields([in]object RowFields, [in]object ColumnFields, [in]object PageFields, [in]object AddToTable) runtime managed
Public Function AddFields (Optional RowFields As Object, Optional ColumnFields As Object, Optional PageFields As Object, Optional AddToTable As Object) As Object

Docs.param: Optional Object. Specifies a field name (or an array of field names) to be added as rows or to be added to the category axis.
Optional Object. Specifies a field name (or an array of field names) to be added as columns or to be added to the series axis.
Optional Object. Specifies a field name (or an array of field names) to be added as pages or to be added to the page area.

Optional Object. Applies only to PivotTable reports. True to add the specified fields to the report (none of the existing fields are replaced). False to replace existing fields with the new fields. The default value is False.
Docs.summary: Adds row, column, and page fields to a PivotTable report or PivotChart report.

remarks.para: You must specify one of the field arguments.
Field names specify the unique name returned by the property of the object.
This method is not available for OLAP data sources.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AllocateChanges() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Performs a writeback operation for all edited cells in a PivotTable report based on an OLAP data source.

remarks.para: The method will execute an UPDATE CUBE statement for all changes made in the values area of the PivotTable since the last apply changes operation was committed, or since the PivotTable was created if committing apply changes has never been performed. This method generates a run-time error if it is executed on a PivotTable report based on a non-OLAP data source.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlAllocation Allocation { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlAllocation get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlAllocation value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether to run an UPDATE CUBE statement for each cell is edited, or only when the user chooses to calculate changes when performing what-if analysis on a PivotTable based on an OLAP data source.

remarks.para: Read/write.

The property corresponds to the Calculate with changes setting in the What-If Analysis Settings dialog box. The default setting is , which corresponds to the Manually (when selecting calculate PivotTable with changes) setting.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlAllocationMethod AllocationMethod { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlAllocationMethod get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlAllocationMethod value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets what method to use to allocate values when performing what-if analysis on a PivotTable report based on an OLAP data source.

remarks.para: Read/write.

The property corresponds to the Allocation Method setting in the What-If Analysis Settings dialog box. The default setting is , which corresponds to the Equal Allocation setting. If the property is set to , which corresponds to the Weighted Allocation setting, you can optionally specify the weight expression to use by setting the property. If you do not specify a weight expression, a weight expression equivalent to <leaf cell value> / <existing value> is used.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlAllocationValue AllocationValue { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlAllocationValue get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlAllocationValue value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets what value to allocate when performing what-if analysis on a PivotTable report based on an OLAP data source.

remarks.para: Read/write.

The property corresponds to the Value to Allocate setting in the What-If Analysis Settings dialog box. The default setting is , which corresponds to the The value entered divided by the number of allocations setting.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ AllocationWeightExpression { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the MDX weight expression to use when performing what-if analysis on a PivotTable report based on an OLAP data source.
Docs.value: The MDX weight expression to use when performing what-if analysis on a PivotTable report based on an OLAP data source.

remarks.para: Read/write.
The property corresponds to the Weight Expression setting in the What-If Analysis Settings dialog box. Before the property can be set, you must set the property to .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowMultipleFilters { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Sets or retrieves a value that indicates whether a can have multiple filters applied to it at the same time. Read/write.

remarks.para: Default value is False.

When this property is set to True, multiple filters can be applied to a single . When it is set to False, applying a filter to a that is already filtered will remove the existing filter and apply the new one.
Setting this property to False when the has fields with more than one filter applied will silently remove all filters in the without displaying any alert. However, there is an alert when this is done through the user interface.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ AlternativeText { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the descriptive (alternative) text string for the specified PivotTable.
Docs.value: The descriptive (alternative) text string for the specified PivotTable.

remarks.para: Read/write.
The value of the property corresponds to the value in the Title box on the Alt Text tab of the PivotTable Options dialog box.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the Microsoft Excel application. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int CacheIndex { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the index number of the PivotTable cache. Read/write Integer.

remarks.para: If you set the CacheIndex property so that one PivotTable report uses the cache for a second PivotTable report, the first report’s fields must be a valid subset of the fields in the second report.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.CalculatedFields CalculatedFields() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents all the calculated fields in the specified PivotTable report. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CalculatedMembers As CalculatedMembers

Docs.summary: Returns a collection representing all the calculated members and calculated measures for an OLAP PivotTable.

remarks.para: This property is used for Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) sources; a non-OLAP source will return a run-time error.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool CalculatedMembersInFilters { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether to evaluate calculated members from OLAP servers in filters.
Docs.value: true if calculated members from OLAP servers should be evaluated in filters; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Read/write.
true if calculated members are evaluated in filters; otherwise false.

The value of this property corresponds to the setting of the Evaluate calculated members from OLAP servers in filters check box on the Totals & Filters tab of the PivotTable Options dialog box for a PivotTable report based on an OLAP data source.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ChangeConnection([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.WorkbookConnection conn) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required object that represents the new connection for the .
Docs.summary: Changes the connection of the specified .

remarks.para: The method can only be used with a that is connected to an external data source. A run-time error will occur if the method is used with a that uses data stored on a worksheet as its data source.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ChangeList As PivotTableChangeList

Docs.summary: Gets the collection that represents the list of changes that have been made to the specified PivotTable based on an OLAP data source.
Docs.value: The collection that represents the list of changes that have been made to the specified PivotTable based on an OLAP data source.

remarks.para: Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ChangePivotCache([in]object PivotCache) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required String a or object that represents the new for the specified .
Docs.summary: Changes the of the specified .

remarks.para: The method can only be used with a that uses data stored on a worksheet as its data source. A run-time error will occur if the method is used with a that is connected to an external data source.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ClearAllFilters() runtime managed

Docs.summary: The method deletes all filters currently applied to the . This includes deleting all filters in the collection of the object, removing any manual filtering applied and setting all s in the Report Filter area to the default item.

remarks.para: After calling the method, the collection will be empty.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ClearTable() runtime managed

Docs.summary: The method is used for clearing a . Clearing s includes removing all the fields and deleting all filtering and sorting applied to the . This method resets the to the state it had right after it was created, before any fields were added to it.

remarks.para: The function takes no arguments and is available for both relational and OLAP s.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ColumnFields(Optional Index As Object) As Object
public: property System::Object ^ ColumnFields[System::Object ^] { System::Object ^ get(System::Object ^ Index); };

Docs.param: Optional Object. The field name or number (can be an array to specify more than one field).
Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents either a single PivotTable field (a object) or a collection of all the fields (a object) that are currently shown as column fields. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ColumnGrand { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the PivotTable report shows grand totals for columns. Read/write Boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ColumnRange As Range
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ ColumnRange { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the range that contains the column area in the PivotTable report. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CommitChanges() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Performs a commit operation on the data source of a PivotTable report based on an OLAP data source.

remarks.para: The method sends a COMMIT TRANSACTION statement to the OLAP server, and clears all cells that were edited by entering a value, but will not clear formulas in value cells. This method generates a run-time error if it is executed on a PivotTable report based on a non-OLAP data source.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ CompactLayoutColumnHeader { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Specifies the caption that is displayed in the column header of a when in compact row layout form. Read/write.

remarks.para: When the user customizes these captions in the grid, it is also reflected in these properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ CompactLayoutRowHeader { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Specifies the caption that is displayed in the row header of a when in compact row layout form. Read/write.

remarks.para: When the user customizes these captions in the grid, it is also reflected in these properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int CompactRowIndent { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the indent increment for when compact row layout form is turned on. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is 1. The valid values for this setting are 0 to the maximum indent specified in Microsoft Excel.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ConvertToFormulas([in]bool ConvertFilters) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Boolean Contains True or False to indicate the state of the ReportFilter area.
Docs.summary: The method is new in 1st_Excel12 and is used for converting a to cube formulas.

remarks.para: The argument controls whether or not to convert the ReportFilter area of the .

MemberSignature.Value: public string CreateCubeFile (string File, object Measures, object Levels, object Members, object Properties);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string CreateCubeFile([in]string File, [in]object Measures, [in]object Levels, [in]object Members, [in]object Properties) runtime managed
Public Function CreateCubeFile (File As String, Optional Measures As Object, Optional Levels As Object, Optional Members As Object, Optional Properties As Object) As String

Docs.param: Required String. The name of the cube file to be created. It will overwrite the file if it already exists.
Optional Object. An array of unique names of measures that are to be part of the slice.
Optional Object. An array of strings. Each array item is a unique level name. It represents the lowest level of a hierarchy that is in the slice.

Optional Object. An array of string arrays. The elements correspond, in order, to the hierarchies represented in the array. Each element is an array of string arrays that consists of the unique names of the top level members in the dimension that are to be included in the slice.
Optional Boolean. False results in no member properties being included in the slice. The default value is True.
Docs.summary: Creates a cube file from a PivotTable report connected to an Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) data source.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As XlCreator

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which this object was created. If the object was created in Microsoft Excel, this property returns the string XCEL, which is equivalent to the hexadecimal number 5843454C. Read-only .

remarks.para: The Creator property is designed to be used in Microsoft Excel for the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Excel has the creator code XCEL.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CubeFields As CubeFields

Docs.summary: Returns the collection. Each object contains the properties of the cube field element. Read-only.

public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ DataBodyRange { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the range that contains the data area in the list between the header row and the insert row. Read-only.

public: property System::Object ^ DataFields[System::Object ^] { System::Object ^ get(System::Object ^ Index); };

Docs.param: Optional Object. The field name or number (can be an array to specify more than one field).
Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents either a single PivotTable field (a object) or a collection of all the fields (a object) that are currently shown as data fields. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DataLabelRange As Range
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ DataLabelRange { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the range that contains the labels for the data fields in the PivotTable report. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DataPivotField As PivotField

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents all the data fields in a PivotTable. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DiscardChanges() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Discards all changes in the edited cells of a PivotTable report based on an OLAP data source.

remarks.para: For a PivotTable report based on an OLAP data source, the method removes all values and formulas entered in value cells, and then runs a PivotTable update operation to retrieve the latest values from the data source. It sets the data source value to a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) for all value cells that are edited, and also executes a ROLLBACK TRANSACTION statement against the OLAP server.
If you try to execute this method for a PivotTable report based on a non-OLAP data source, this method generates a run-time error.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisplayContextTooltips { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Controls whether or not tooltips are displayed for cells. Read/write.

remarks.para: If is set to False, contextual tooltips for cells will not be displayed. If it is set to True, tooltips for cells in the row, column, and data areas will be displayed.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisplayEmptyColumn { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns True when the non-empty MDX keyword is included in the query to the OLAP provider for the value axis. The OLAP provider will not return empty columns in the result set. Returns False when the non-empty keyword is omitted. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: The PivotTable must be connected to an Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) data source to avoid a run-time error.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisplayEmptyRow { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns True when the non-empty MDX keyword is included in the query to the OLAP provider for the category axis. The OLAP provider will not return empty rows in the result set. Returns False when the non-empty keyword is omitted. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: The PivotTable must be connected to an Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) data source to avoid a run-time error.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisplayErrorString { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the PivotTable report displays a custom error string in cells that contain errors. The default value is False. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: Use the property to set the custom error string.
This property is particularly useful for suppressing divide-by-zero errors when calculated fields are pivoted.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisplayFieldCaptions { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Controls whether or not filter buttons and captions for rows and columns are displayed in the grid. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is True.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisplayImmediateItems { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean that indicates whether items in the row and column areas are visible when the data area of the PivotTable is empty. Set this property to False to hide the items in the row and column areas when the data area of the PivotTable is empty. The default value is True.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisplayMemberPropertyTooltips { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Controls whether or not to display member properties in tooltips. Read/write.

remarks.para: If is set to False, no member properties will be displayed in tooltips. If it is set to True, member properties will be displayed in tooltips.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisplayNullString { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the PivotTable report displays a custom string in cells that contain null values. The default value is True. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: Use the property to set the custom null string.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DrillDown (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.PivotItem PivotItem, object PivotLine);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DrillDown([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.PivotItem PivotItem, [in]object PivotLine) runtime managed

Docs.param: The member from which the drill down is performed.
Specifies the line in the PivotTable where the operation starting member resides. In cases where PivotLine is not specified, defaults to the top PivotLine where the member appears.
Docs.summary: Enables you to drill down into the data within an OLAP or PowerPivot based cube hierarchy.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DrillTo (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.PivotItem PivotItem, Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.CubeField CubeField, object PivotLine);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DrillTo([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.PivotItem PivotItem, [in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.CubeField CubeField, [in]object PivotLine) runtime managed

Docs.param: The member from which the drill operation is performed.
The target hierarchy being drilled to.
Specifies the line in the PivotTable where the operation starting member resides. In cases where PivotLine is not specified, defaults to the top PivotLine where the member appears.
Docs.summary: Enables you to drill to a location within an OLAP or PowerPivot based cube hierarchy.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DrillUp (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.PivotItem PivotItem, object PivotLine, object LevelUniqueName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DrillUp([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.PivotItem PivotItem, [in]object PivotLine, [in]object LevelUniqueName) runtime managed

Docs.param: The member from which the drill up is performed.
Specifies the line in the PivotTable where the operation starting member resides. In cases where PivotLine is not specified, defaults to the top PivotLine where the member appears.
The target for a multi-level drill up. The default action if not specified is a one level drill up.
Docs.summary: Enables you to drill up into the data within an OLAP or PowerPivot based cube hierarchy.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool EnableDataValueEditing { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True to disable the alert for when the user overwrites values in the data area of the PivotTable. True also allows the user to change data values that previously could not be changed. The default value is False. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: Any editing performed on data values is lost upon refresh.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool EnableDrilldown { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if drilldown is enabled. The default value is True. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: Setting this property for a PivotTable report sets it for all fields in that report.
For OLAP data sources, the value is always True.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool EnableFieldDialog { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the PivotTable Field dialog box is available when the user double-clicks the PivotTable field. The default value is True. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: Setting this property for a PivotTable report sets it for all fields in that report.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool EnableFieldList { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: False to disable the ability to display the field list for the PivotTable. If the field list was already being displayed it disappears. The default value is True. Read/write Boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool EnableWizard { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the PivotTable Wizard is available. The default value is True. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: When this property is set, the field wells aren’t displayed on the worksheet.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool EnableWriteback { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether writing back to the data source is enabled for the specified PivotTable.
Docs.value: true if writing back to the data source is enabled for the specified PivotTable; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

remarks.para: Read/write.

For OLAP data sources, setting to the property to true to enables writeback and disables the alert for when the user overwrites values in the data area of the PivotTable. For non-OLAP data sources, setting the property to true enables write-back in code, and also allows the user to change data values that previously could not be changed.
The and properties of the object cannot be set to true at the same time.
If the property is set to true and then the property is set to true, the property is set to false automatically, the PivotTable is refreshed, and any editing performed on data values is lost.
If the property is set to true and then the property is set to true, the property is set to false automatically, the PivotTable is not refreshed, and the data source values are restored.
For non-OLAP data sources, setting this property generates a run-time error.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ErrorString { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the string displayed in cells that contain errors when the property is True. The default value is an empty string (""). Read/write String.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool FieldListSortAscending { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Controls the sort order of fields in the Field List. Read/write.

remarks.para: When this property is set to True, the fields are sorted in ascending order. When it is set to False, the fields are sorted in data source order.
Does not apply to connected to OLAP data sources.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Format([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlPivotFormatType Format) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required . Specifies the type of report formatting to be applied to the specified PivotTable report.
Docs.summary: Sets a PivotTable report to one of the predefined indented, nonindented, or cross-tabulated formats.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance float64 GetData([in]string Name) runtime managed
Public Function GetData (Name As String) As Double

Docs.param: Required String. Describes a single cell in the PivotTable report, using syntax similar to the method or the PivotTable report references in calculated item formulas.
Docs.summary: Returns data from the specified PivotTable cell.

Docs.summary: Returns a Range object with information about a data item in a PivotTable report.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ GrandTotalName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the text string label that is displayed in the grand total column or row heading in the specified PivotTable report. The default value is the string "Grand Total". Read/write String.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool HasAutoFormat { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the PivotTable report is automatically formatted when it’s refreshed or when fields are moved. Read/write Boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Hidden As Boolean
public: property bool Hidden { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Checks whether the PivotTable exists at the worksheet level. Boolean (bool in C#). Read-only

remarks.para: When the Hidden property is set to True, the PivotTable object is hidden from the worksheet level. When the property is set to False, the PivotTable exists on a worksheet.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HiddenFields(Optional Index As Object) As Object
public: property System::Object ^ HiddenFields[System::Object ^] { System::Object ^ get(System::Object ^ Index); };

Docs.param: Optional Object. The name or number of the field to be returned (can be an array to specify more than one field).
Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents either a single PivotTable field (a object) or a collection of all the fields (a object) that are currently not shown as row, column, page, or data fields. Read-only.

remarks.para: For OLAP data sources, this property always returns an empty collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool InGridDropZones { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: This property is used to toggle in-grid drop zones for a object. In some cases, it also affects the layout of the . Read/write.

remarks.para: When the property is set to True, the in-grid representation of the is the same as it was in Excel 2003. When the property is set to False, there are no in-grid drop zones. The layout also changes with this property.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ InnerDetail { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the name of the field that will be shown as detail when the property is True for the innermost row or column field. Read/write String.

remarks.para: This property isn’t available for OLAP data sources.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlLayoutRowType LayoutRowDefault { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlLayoutRowType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlLayoutRowType value); };

Docs.summary: This property specifies the layout settings for when they are added to the for the first time. Read/write.

remarks.para: can be either xlCompactRow, xlTabularRow, or xlOutlineRow.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ListFormulas() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Creates a list of calculated PivotTable items and fields on a separate worksheet.

remarks.para: This method isn’t available for OLAP data sources.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Location { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a String that represents the top-left cell in the body of the specified . Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ManualUpdate { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the PivotTable report is recalculated only at the user's request. The default value is False. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: This property is set to False immediately after your program terminates.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MDX As String
public: property System::String ^ MDX { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String indicating the MDX (Multidimensional Expression) that would be sent to the provider to populate the current PivotTable view. Read-only.

remarks.para: Querying this value for a non-Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) PivotTable, or when there is no PivotTable view (no data items), will return a run-time error.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool MergeLabels { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the specified PivotTable report’s outer-row item, column item, subtotal, and grand total labels use merged cells. Read/write Boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the name of the object. Read/write String.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ NullString { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the string displayed in cells that contain null values when the property is True. The default value is an empty string (""). Read/write String.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int PageFieldOrder { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the order in which page fields are added to the PivotTable report’s layout. Can be one of the following constants: xlDownThenOver or xlOverThenDown. The default constant is xlDownThenOver. Read/write Integer.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PageFields(Optional Index As Object) As Object
public: property System::Object ^ PageFields[System::Object ^] { System::Object ^ get(System::Object ^ Index); };

Docs.param: Optional Object. The name or number of the field to be returned (can be an array to specify more than one field).
Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents either a single PivotTable field (a object) or a collection of all the fields (a object) that are currently showing as page fields. Read-only.

remarks.para: A hierarchy can contain only one page field.
For a PivotTable report based on a PivotTable cache, the collection of PivotTable fields that’s returned reflects what’s currently in the cache.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ PageFieldStyle { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the style used in the bound page field area. The default value is a null string (no style is applied by default). Read/write String.

remarks.para: This style is used as the default style for the background area, and it’s applied before any user formatting. Cells vacated when a field is pivoted from the page field area to another location retain this style.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int PageFieldWrapCount { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the number of page fields in each column or row in the PivotTable report. Read/write Integer.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PageRange As Range
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ PageRange { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the range that contains the page area in the PivotTable report. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PageRangeCells As Range
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ PageRangeCells { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents only the cells in the specified PivotTable report that contain the page fields and item drop-down lists.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the parent object for the specified object. Read-only

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.PivotCache PivotCache() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the cache for the specified PivotTable report. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PivotChart As Shape
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Shape ^ PivotChart { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Shape ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the standalone PivotChart for the specified hidden PivotTable report. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PivotColumnAxis As PivotAxis

Docs.summary: Returns a object representing the entire column axis. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object PivotFields([in]object Index) runtime managed
Public Function PivotFields (Optional Index As Object) As Object

Docs.param: Optional Object. The name or number of the field to be returned.
Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents either a single PivotTable field (a object) or a collection of both the visible and hidden fields (a object) in the PivotTable report. Read-only.

remarks.para: For OLAP data sources there are no hidden fields, and the object or collection that’s returned reflects what’s currently visible.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PivotFormulas As PivotFormulas

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the collection of formulas for the specified report. Read-only.

remarks.para: For OLAP data sources, this property returns an empty collection.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PivotRowAxis As PivotAxis

Docs.summary: Returns a object representing the entire row axis. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public void PivotSelect (string Name, Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlPTSelectionMode Mode = Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlPTSelectionMode.xlDataAndLabel, object UseStandardName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void PivotSelect([in]string Name, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlPTSelectionMode Mode, [in]object UseStandardName) runtime managed
Public Sub PivotSelect (Name As String, Optional Mode As XlPTSelectionMode = Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlPTSelectionMode.xlDataAndLabel, Optional UseStandardName As Object)

Docs.param: Required String. The selection, in standard PivotTable report selection format.
Optional . Specifies the structured selection mode.
Optional Object. True for recorded macros that will play back in other locales.
Docs.summary: Selects part of a PivotTable report.

remarks.para: You can use the specified mode only to select the corresponding item in the PivotTable report. For example, you cannot select data and labels by using xlButton mode; likewise, you cannot select buttons by using xlDataOnly mode.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ PivotSelection { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the PivotTable selection in standard PivotTable report selection format. Read/write String.

remarks.para: Setting this property is equivalent to calling the method with the argument set to xlDataAndLabel.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ PivotSelectionStandard { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String indicating the PivotTable selection in standard PivotTable report format using English (United States) settings. Read/write.

remarks.para: The PivotSelectionStandard property is "international-friendly" whereas the property is not.

MemberSignature.Value: public void PivotTableWizard (object SourceType, object SourceData, object TableDestination, object TableName, object RowGrand, object ColumnGrand, object SaveData, object HasAutoFormat, object AutoPage, object Reserved, object BackgroundQuery, object OptimizeCache, object PageFieldOrder, object PageFieldWrapCount, object ReadData, object Connection);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void PivotTableWizard([in]object SourceType, [in]object SourceData, [in]object TableDestination, [in]object TableName, [in]object RowGrand, [in]object ColumnGrand, [in]object SaveData, [in]object HasAutoFormat, [in]object AutoPage, [in]object Reserved, [in]object BackgroundQuery, [in]object OptimizeCache, [in]object PageFieldOrder, [in]object PageFieldWrapCount, [in]object ReadData, [in]object Connection) runtime managed

Public Sub PivotTableWizard (Optional SourceType As Object, Optional SourceData As Object, Optional TableDestination As Object, Optional TableName As Object, Optional RowGrand As Object, Optional ColumnGrand As Object, Optional SaveData As Object, Optional HasAutoFormat As Object, Optional AutoPage As Object, Optional Reserved As Object, Optional BackgroundQuery As Object, Optional OptimizeCache As Object, Optional PageFieldOrder As Object, Optional PageFieldWrapCount As Object, Optional ReadData As Object, Optional Connection As Object)

Docs.param: Optional . The source of the report data.

Optional Object. The data for the new report. Can be a object, an array of ranges, or a text constant that represents the name of another report. For an external database, is an array of strings containing the SQL query string, where each element is up to 255 characters in length. You should use the argument to specify the ODBC connection string. For compatibility with earlier versions of Excel, can be a two-element array. The first element is the connection string specifying the ODBC source for the data. The second element is the SQL query string used to get the data. If you specify , you must also specify . If the active cell is inside the range, you must specify as well.
Optional Object. A Range object specifying where the report should be placed on the worksheet. If this argument is omitted, the report is placed at the active cell.
Optional Object. A string that specifies the name of the new report.
Optional Object. True to show grand totals for rows in the report.
Optional Object. True to show grand totals for columns in the report.
Optional Object. True to save data with the report. False to save only the report definition.
Optional Object. True to have Microsoft Excel automatically format the report when it’s refreshed or when fields are moved.
Optional Object. Valid only if is xlConsolidation. True to have Microsoft Excel create a page field for the consolidation. If is False, you must create the page field or fields.
Optional Object. Not used by Microsoft Excel.
Optional Object. True to have Excel perform queries for the report asynchronously (in the background). The default value is False.
Optional Object. True to optimize the PivotTable cache when it's constructed. The default value is False.

Optional Object. The order in which page fields are added to the PivotTable report’s layout. Can be one of the following constants: xlDownThenOver or xlOverThenDown. The default value is xlDownThenOver.
Optional Object. The number of page fields in each column or row in the PivotTable report. The default value is 0 (zero).

Optional Object. True to create a PivotTable cache that contains all records from the external database; this cache can be very large. If is False, you can set some of the fields as server-based page fields before the data is actually read.

Optional Object. A string that contains ODBC settings that allow Excel to connect to an ODBC data source. The connection string has the form "ODBC;<connection string>". This argument overrides any previous setting for the object’s property.
Docs.summary: Creates a object. This method doesn’t display the PivotTable Wizard. This method isn’t available for OLE DB data sources. Use the method to add a PivotTable cache, and then create a PivotTable report based on the cache.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.PivotValueCell PivotValueCell([in]object rowline, [in]object columnline) runtime managed
Public Function PivotValueCell (Optional rowline As Object, Optional columnline As Object) As PivotValueCell

Docs.param: If of type PivotLine, specifies the PivotLine in the row area that the PivotValueCell is aligned with. If of type Int, then specifies position of the PivotLine on the row area that the PivotValueCell is aligned with. If missing, Empty, Null, or 0 specifies the grand total row.

If of type PivotLine, specifies the PivotLine in the column area that the PivotValueCell is aligned with. If of type Int, then specifies position of the PivotLine on the column area that the PivotValueCell is aligned with. If missing, Empty, Null or 0, specifies the grand total column.
Docs.summary: Retrieve the object for a given PivotTable provided certain row and column indices.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool PreserveFormatting { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: This property is True if formatting is preserved when the report is refreshed or recalculated by operations such as pivoting, sorting, or changing page field items. Read/write Boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool PrintDrillIndicators { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Specifies whether or not drill indicators are printed with the . Read/write.

remarks.para: Returns True if drill indicators are printed with the and returns False if drill indicators are not printed with the .
When the property is set to False, the property has no effect. Drill indicators are not printed when they are not displayed in the .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool PrintTitles { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the print titles for the worksheet are set based on the PivotTable report. False if the print titles for the worksheet are used. The default value is False. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: The row print titles are set to the rows that contain the PivotTable report’s column field items. The column print titles are set to the columns that contain the row items.
The PivotTable report must be the only one in the print area. To set an indented format for a PivotTable report, use the method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RefreshDataSourceValues() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves the current values from the data source for all edited cells in a PivotTable report that is in writeback mode.

remarks.para: To determine if a PivotTable report is in writeback mode, check the or properties of the object, either of which will return True. For PivotTable reports that are not in writeback mode, trying to execute this method generates a run-time error.

For PivotTable reports with OLAP data sources, executing the method creates a separate connection to the OLAP server and executes the full MDX query (the value of the . property) that is used to perform an update operation to populate the PivotTable report. Excel extracts the values returned for all cells that have been edited in the PivotTable view, and then stores them in the property for those cells.
This method applies only to PivotTable reports with OLAP data sources. Trying to execute this method or PivotTable reports with non-OLAP data sources generates a run-time error.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RefreshDate As DateTime
public: property DateTime RefreshDate { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the date on which the PivotTable report was last refreshed. Read-only DateTime.

remarks.para: For OLAP data sources, this property is updated after each query.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RefreshName As String
public: property System::String ^ RefreshName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the name of the person who last refreshed the PivotTable report data or the PivotTable cache. Read-only String.

remarks.para: For OLAP data sources, this property is updated after each query.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool RefreshTable() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Refreshes the PivotTable report from the source data. Returns True if it’s successful.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RepeatAllLabels([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlPivotFieldRepeatLabels Repeat) runtime managed

Docs.param: Specifies whether to repeat item labels for all PivotFields in the specified PivotTable.
Docs.summary: Sets whether to repeat item labels for all PivotFields in the specified PivotTable.

remarks.para: Using the method corresponds to the Repeat All Item Labels and Do Not Repeat Item Labels commands on the Report Layout drop-down list of the PivotTable Tools Design tab.
To specify whether to repeat item labels for a single PivotField, use the property.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool RepeatItemsOnEachPrintedPage { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if row, column, and item labels appear on the first row of each page when the specified PivotTable report is printed. False if labels are printed only on the first page. The default value is True. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: The PivotTable report must be the only one in the print area. To set an indented format for a PivotTable report, use the method.
Microsoft Excel prints row and column labels in place of any print titles set for the worksheet. Use the property to determine whether print titles are set for the PivotTable report.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RowAxisLayout([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlLayoutRowType RowLayout) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Can be xlCompactRow, xlTabularRow, or xlOutlineRow.
Docs.summary: This method is used for simultaneously setting layout options for all existing s.

remarks.para: This method is atomic so it makes sure that if layout options cannot be set on any , the layout options of none of the fields will change and no change is made to the .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RowFields(Optional Index As Object) As Object
public: property System::Object ^ RowFields[System::Object ^] { System::Object ^ get(System::Object ^ Index); };

Docs.param: Optional Object. The name or number of the field to be returned (can be an array to specify more than one field).
Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents either a single field in a PivotTable report (a object) or a collection of all the fields (a object) that are currently showing as row fields. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool RowGrand { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the PivotTable report shows grand totals for rows. Read/write Boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RowRange As Range
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ RowRange { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the range including the row area on the PivotTable report. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool SaveData { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if data for the PivotTable report is saved with the workbook. False if only the report definition is saved. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: For OLAP data sources, this property is always set to False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlPTSelectionMode SelectionMode { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlPTSelectionMode get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlPTSelectionMode value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the PivotTable report structured selection mode. Read/write .

remarks.para: If the PivotTable field isn’t in outline form, specifying the sum of any of the constants and xlFirstRow is equivalent to specifying the constant alone.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowCellBackgroundFromOLAP { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the MDX (Multidimensional Expression) that Microsoft Excel sends to the server includes the property for each cell in the data area that corresponds to a cell in the Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) data set. The default value is False. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: If the OLAP data set returns a BackColor property value, then the cell fill color is set to the nearest color in Microsoft Excel's palette for that worksheet. If the user applies cell pattern formatting to the cell manually, that will override any formatting from the OLAP data set.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowDrillIndicators { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property is used for toggling the display of drill indicators in the . Read/write.

remarks.para: Returns True if drill indicators are displayed in the and returns False if drill indicators are not displayed in the .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowPageMultipleItemLabel { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: When set to True (default), "(Multiple Items)" will appear in the PivotTable cell on the worksheet whenever items are hidden and an aggregate of non-hidden items is shown in the PivotTable view. Read/write Boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object ShowPages([in]object PageField) runtime managed
Public Function ShowPages (Optional PageField As Object) As Object

Docs.param: Optional Object. A string that names a single page field in the report.
Docs.summary: Creates a new PivotTable report for each item in the page field. Each new report is created on a new worksheet.

remarks.para: This method isn’t available for OLAP data sources.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowTableStyleColumnHeaders { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property is set to True if the column headers should be displayed in the . Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowTableStyleColumnStripes { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The Boolean property displays banded columns in which even columns are formatted differently from odd columns. This makes easier to read. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowTableStyleLastColumn { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowTableStyleRowHeaders { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property is set to True if the row headers should be displayed in the . Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowTableStyleRowStripes { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property displays banded rows in which even rows are formatted differently from odd rows. This makes easier to read. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowValuesRow { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether the values row is displayed.
Docs.value: true if the values row is displayed; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Read/write.
This property corresponds to the setting of the Show the Values row check box on the Display tab of the PivotTable Options dialog box.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Slicers As Slicers

Docs.summary: Gets the collection for the specified PivotTable.
Docs.value: The collection for the specified PivotTable.

remarks.para: Read-only.
Slicers can be used to filter data in PivotTable reports. The collection contains objects that represent the slicers that are associated with the specified PivotTable.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool SmallGrid { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Excel uses a grid that’s two cells wide and two cells deep for a newly created PivotTable report. False if Excel uses a blank stencil outline. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: You should use the stencil outline. The grid is provided only because it enables compatibility with earlier versions of Excel.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool SortUsingCustomLists { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property controls whether custom lists are used for sorting items of fields, both initially when the is initialized and the are ordered by their captions; and later when the user applies a sort. Read/write.

remarks.para: Setting this property to False can optimize performance for fields with many items, and it also allows users who do not want custom list-based sorting to avoid it.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ SourceData { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns the data source for the PivotTable report. Read-write Object.

remarks.para: The value returned depends on the data source, as follows:

item.description: An array. Each row consists of a SQL connection string with the remaining elements as the query string, broken down into 255-character segments.
A two-dimensional array. Each row consists of a reference and its associated page field items.
One of the above three kinds of information.

remarks.para: This property is not available for OLE DB data sources.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool SubtotalHiddenPageItems { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if hidden page field items in the PivotTable report are included in row and column subtotals, block totals, and grand totals. The default value is False. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: For OLAP data sources, the value is always True.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SubtotalLocation([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlSubtototalLocationType Location) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required can be either xlAtTop or xlAtBottom.
Docs.summary: This method changes the subtotal location for all existing . Changing the subtotal location has an immediate visual effect only for fields in outline form, but it will be set for fields in tabular form as well.

remarks.para: The method sets the property for all existing s automatically.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Summary { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the description associated with the alternative text string for the specified PivotTable.
Docs.value: The description associated with the alternative text string for the specified PivotTable.

remarks.para: Read/write.
The value of the property corresponds to the value in the Description box on the Alt Text tab of the PivotTable Options dialog box.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TableRange1 As Range
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ TableRange1 { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the range containing the entire PivotTable report, but doesn’t include page fields. Read-only.

remarks.para: The property includes page fields.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TableRange2 As Range
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ TableRange2 { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Range ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the range containing the entire PivotTable report, including page fields. Read-only.

remarks.para: The property doesn’t include page fields.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ TableStyle { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the style used in the body of the PivotTable report. The default value is a null string (no style is applied by default). Read/write String.

remarks.para: This style is used as the default style for the background area, and it’s applied before any user formatting.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ TableStyle2 { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property specifies the style currently applied to the . Read/write.

remarks.para: The property is called because there is an existing property named .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Tag { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a string saved with the PivotTable report. Read/write String.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool TotalsAnnotation { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if an asterisk (*) is displayed next to each subtotal and grand total value in the specified PivotTable report if the report is based on an OLAP data source. The default value is True. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: When this property is set to True, the asterisk indicates that hidden items are included in the total. The asterisk appears regardless of whether any items in the report have been hidden.
For non-OLAP data sources, the value of this property is always False.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Update() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Updates the link or PivotTable report.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ VacatedStyle { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the style applied to cells vacated when the PivotTable report is refreshed. The default value is a null string (no style is applied by default). Read/write String.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Value { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The name of the PivotTable report. Read/write String.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Version As XlPivotTableVersionList

Docs.summary: Returns the Microsoft Excel version number. Read-only .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ViewCalculatedMembers { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: When set to True (default), calculated members for Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) PivotTables can be viewed. Read/write Boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property VisibleFields(Optional Index As Object) As Object
public: property System::Object ^ VisibleFields[System::Object ^] { System::Object ^ get(System::Object ^ Index); };

Docs.param: Optional Object. The name or number of the field to be returned (can be an array to specify more than one field).
Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents either a single field in a PivotTable report (a object) or a collection of all the visible fields (a object). Visible fields are shown as row, column, page, or data fields. Read-only.

remarks.para: For OLAP data sources there are no hidden fields, and this property returns all the fields in the PivotTable cache.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool VisualTotals { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True (default) to enable Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) PivotTables to recalculate the total after an item has been hidden from view. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: In non-OLAP PivotTables, if you hide an item, the total is recomputed to reflect only the items that remain visible in the PivotTable. In an OLAP PivotTable, the total is computed on the server and is therefore unaffected by whether any items are hidden in the PivotTable view. However, if the VisualTotals property is set to False for an OLAP PivotTable, then the results of the OLAP PivotTable will match those of the non-OLAP PivotTable.
For OLAP PivotTables, a VisualTotals property setting of True (default) works the same way as described for non-OLAP PivotTables.

The VisualTotals property returns True for all new PivotTables. However, if you open a workbook in the current version of Microsoft Excel and the PivotTable had been created in a previous version of Excel, the VisualTotals property will return False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool VisualTotalsForSets { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether to include filtered items in the totals of named sets for the specified PivotTable.
Docs.value: true if filtered items in the totals of named sets for the specified PivotTable are included; otherwise, false. The default is false

remarks.para: Read/write.
true if filtered items are included in the totals for named sets; otherwise false. The default value of this property is false.

In a PivotTable based on an OLAP data source, you can configure whether totals for named sets in the PivotTable will include items that have been filtered. The setting of the property corresponds to the Include filtered items in set totals check box on the Totals & Filters tab of the PivotTable Options dialog box.
